text: MTb induces <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression via the <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent signaling cascade

To begin to decipher the cellular mechanisms underlying <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent , MTb - induced HIV-1 replication , we next investigated the requirement for specific signaling molecules in the TLR pathway that are required for MTb stimulation of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression .
We began by examining the requirement of <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation in enhancing <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels .

When THP-1 cells were treated with the <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific agonist Pam3Cys for 16 hours , <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels were significantly increased in Pam3Cys - stimulated cells as compared to mock - stimulated control cells ( Figure 7A ) .
As a positive control for this experiment we also infected THP-1 cells with CDC1551 ( Figure 7A ) .

Notably , MTb infection enhanced <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels to a greater extent than Pam3Cys stimulation , suggesting that additional PRRs may be triggered during actual MTb infection , augmenting its stimulatory effect on <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression ( Figure 7A ) .
The adaptor molecule <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transmits signals upon <extra_id_0> TLR2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation ( reviewed in [ 53 ] ) .

To confirm that this protein and , therefore , that this TLR - dependent pathway is important for MTb induction of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression , we constructed a THP-1 cell line that constitutively expresses a lentivirally-delivered <extra_id_0> short hairpin (sh)RNA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> targeting <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Real-time PCR analysis demonstrated that <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels in these cells were constitutively and significantly reduced in comparison to control THP-1 cells transduced with a lentivirus expressing control <extra_id_0> GFP shRNA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( data not shown ) .

These <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> knockdown THP-1 cells were then infected with MTb ( CDC1551 ) and <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels were examined .

Since <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent gene [ 21 ] , [ 54 ] , [ 55 ] , as a positive control we measured <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels .
For a negative control , we measured mRNA levels of the <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent gene <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 55 ] , [ 56 ] .

As shown in Figure 7B , knockdown of <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> specifically inhibited MTb - induced <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels and had no impact on <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels .
Thus , MTb regulation of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is dependent upon <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

To futher dissect the pathway mediating MTb upregulation of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription , we also constructed THP-1 cells transduced with lentivirally-delivered shRNAs targeting <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , two signaling molecules downstream of <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

As shown in Figures 7C and 7D , knockdown of both <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> significantly inhibited MTb induced <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels .

As expected , MTb - induced <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression was also significantly reduced ( Figures 7C-7D ) , consistent with a role for <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in <extra_id_0> TNF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression secondary to MTb infection as previously reported .

Although <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression did not depend on <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Figure 7B ) , abrogation of <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression significantly reduced <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels , indicating that <extra_id_0> CD86 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent , but <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent in MTb-infected monocytes ( Figures 7C-7D ) .

Taken together , these results clearly demonstrate that MTb upregulation of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in human monocytic cells requires activation of <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the <extra_id_0> MyD88 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - associated adaptor molecules <extra_id_0> IRAK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> TRAF6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
